metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000365 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
The Linux Kernel imposes a size restriction on the arguments andenvironmental strings passed through RLIMIT_STACK/RLIM_INFINITY (1/4 of thesize), but does not take the argument and environment pointers intoaccount, which allows attackers to bypass this limitation. This affectsLinux Kernel versions 4.11.5 and earlier. It appears that this feature wasintroduced in the Linux Kernel version 2.6.23.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000365` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

No subscription required
